columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the set of load balancing rules used by the load balancer. This name can be used to access the resource.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The resource ID.

columns.name: load_balancer_name
columns.description: The friendly name that identifies the load balancer.

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.description: The provisioning state of the load balancing rule resource. Possible values include: 'Succeeded', 'Updating', 'Deleting', 'Failed'.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Type of the resource.

columns.name: etag
columns.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

columns.name: backend_address_pool_id
columns.description: A reference to a pool of DIPs. Inbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.

columns.name: backend_port
columns.description: The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65535. Note that value 0 enables 'Any Port'.

columns.name: disable_outbound_snat
columns.description: Configures SNAT for the VMs in the backend pool to use the publicIP address specified in the frontend of the load balancing rule.

columns.name: enable_floating_ip
columns.description: Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.

columns.name: enable_tcp_reset
columns.description: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

columns.name: frontend_ip_configuration_id
columns.description: A reference to frontend IP addresses.

columns.name: frontend_port
columns.description: The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65534. Note that value 0 enables 'Any Port'.

columns.name: idle_timeout_in_minutes
columns.description: The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

columns.name: load_distribution
columns.description: The load distribution policy for this rule. Possible values include: 'Default', 'SourceIP', 'SourceIPProtocol'.

columns.name: probe_id
columns.description: The reference to the load balancer probe used by the load balancing rule.

columns.name: protocol
columns.description: The reference to the transport protocol used by the load balancing rule. Possible values include: 'UDP', 'TCP', 'All'.

columns.name: backend_address_pools
columns.description: An array of references to pool of DIPs.

columns.name: title
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTitle

columns.name: resource_group
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionResourceGroup
